009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.mask;
011
012/**
013 * Defines a circular mask with the specified radius.
014 * Mask values are 1 inside the radius, 0 outside.
015 * Mask dimensions are square and odd,
016 * the reference point is as the center. 
017 * 
018 * @author WB
019 *
020 */
021public class CircularMask extends BinaryMask {
022        
023        /**
024         * Constructor.
025         * @param radius the mask radius
026         */
027        public CircularMask(double radius) {
028                super(makeMask(radius));
029        }
030        
031        private static byte[][] makeMask(double radius) {
032                int center = Math.max((int) Math.ceil(radius), 1);
033                int width = 2 * center + 1;             // width/height of mask array
034                byte[][] mask = new byte[width][width]; // initialized to zero
035                double r2 = radius * radius + 1;        // add 1 to get mask shape similar to ImageJ
036                for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
037                        int x = i - center;
038                        for (int j = 0; j < width; j++) {
039                                int y = j - center;
040                                if (x*x + y*y <= r2) {
041                                        mask[i][j] = 1;
042                                }
043                        }
044                }
045                return mask;
046        }
047
048}
